intro: Apargia proteiformis, commonly known as the variable apargia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typically blooming in late spring. Apargia proteiformis thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
